thread.title: Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium
thread.title_full: Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium

author: MIKE FITZPATRICK
title: Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium
text:
Seth Wenig Harvey on time, Collins a cutup and mollified Mets off to LA 
New York Mets' David Wright prepares to bat during a workout at Citi Field, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 in New York. The Mets will play the Los Angeles Dodgers in a National League Division Series starting Friday in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig) Danny Moloshok Clayton Kershaw seeks elusive postseason success for Dodgers 
Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw looks on during practice for the upcoming NLDS playoff baseball series against the New York Mets, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in Los Angeles. Their NLDS best of five playoff series begins Friday, Oct. 9, at Dodger Stadium. (AP Photo/Danny Moloshok) Seth Wenig Harvey on time, Collins a cutup and mollified Mets off to LA 
New York Mets' Yoenis Cespedes, left, and Curtis Granderson fist bump during a workout at Citi Field, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 in New York. The Mets will play the Los Angeles Dodgers in a National League Division Series starting Friday in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig) Mark J. Terrill Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Brett Anderson, left, starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw, center, and starting pitcher Zack Greinke sit together during workouts in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill) Kathy Kmonicek Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
New York Mets' Michael Cuddyer address the media during a press conference prior to a baseball practice at Citi Field for NLDS series against the Los Angeles Dodgers, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) Mark J. Terrill Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
The Los Angeles Dodgers workout in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill) Mark J. Terrill Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Zack Greinke warms up during workouts in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill) Mark J. Terrill Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw, right, talks with starting pitcher Brett Anderson during workouts in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill) Seth Wenig Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
New York Mets pitchers Steven Matz, left, Jacob deGrom, center, and Jonathon Niese talk during a workout at Citi Field, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 in New York. The Mets will play the Los Angeles Dodgers in a National League Division Series starting Friday in Los Angeles.. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig) Kathy Kmonicek Mets gear up to face 'those 2 animals' at Dodger Stadium 
New York Mets' Curtis Granderson, left, Michael Cuddyer, center, David Wright, right, await their turn at batting practice during a workout at Citi Field for NLDS series against the Los Angeles Dodgers, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) 
NEW YORK (AP) — Michael Cuddyer and the New York Mets are well aware of the challenge ahead.
